textBox.richText: Most geeks like to relate certain numbers to technology - it’s fun.  One cool game that two of my friends and I play is finding merchandise that is priced at a geek-worthy number.  The frozen steak in the picture above takes the first prize so far with a price of $6.66.  Of course, every geek knows that 666 are the default permissions on a file in UNIX/Linux/OSX. Other geek-worthy numbers include: 404 (File not found) 31173, 1337 and 31337 (Leet speak) 42 (The answer to Life, the Universe and Everything) 1024 (need I explain?) and any good TCP/IP port numbers such as 1723 (PPTP VPN) So next time you see a somewhat socially-challenged individual laboriously examining the meat isle at your local grocery store, remember that it is probably a geek.
